common.noLogYet: No log for this check yet. Run checks to see output.
common.settingsNoExtra: No extra settings. This check is only toggled via „Active“ in My Checks.
common.projectRulesScriptPlaceholder: Edit script (saved as scripts/checks/project-rules.sh). Exit 0 = pass.
common.projectRulesScriptEmptyHint: No script yet. Click „Load standard (AGENTS.md)“ or write your own.
common.projectRulesFormPlaceholder: Form-based rules (e.g. forbidden imports) coming in a later version. Use the Script view.
common.projectRulesFormEmptyHint: No rules yet. Click „Add rule“, then Save.
common.projectRulesScriptNotParseableHint: Script has no RULES_JSON format. Editing the form and saving will overwrite the script.
common.name: Name
common.dragToActivate: Drag to My Shim to activate
common.enforceHint: Allowed: git push, supabase functions deploy, supabase db push, supabase migration, supabase push.
common.hooksHint: Supabase only: supabase functions deploy, supabase db push, supabase migration, supabase push.
common.commandEnterPlaceholder: Enter command, Enter for new tag
common.commandExampleEnforce: e.g. git push, Enter for new tag
common.commandExampleHooks: e.g. supabase functions deploy (Supabase only), Enter for new tag
common.commandNewTag: Enter command, Enter for new tag
common.noMyChecksYet: No My Checks yet. Drag from Check Library here.
common.dragFromLibrary: Grab checks by the ⋮⋮ handle (left on the card) and drag into the area above.
common.removeFromMyShim: Remove from My Shim (back to Check Library)
common.reviewsIntro: When review mode is on for a check, a report is saved as .md after each run.
common.reviewsOutputPathHint: Directory relative to project root. Example: reports or .shimwrapper/reviews
common.reviewsCheckListHint: Turn review mode on or off per check in Templates → My Checks.

myChecks.title: My Checks
myChecks.idealOrderHint: Recommended order – activate checks here or remove them from the list.

settings.uiPortDesc: Which port the UI should use or whether a free port is chosen automatically.
settings.presetIntro: Choose preset and enable/disable checks. Trigger commands (Supabase/Git) are set in My Shim. Save writes .shimwrappercheckrc.
settings.presetStorageHint: Presets are saved in this project. Use Export to reuse in another project.
settings.renamePresetHint: New name (also shown in My Shim):

config.title: Config (.shimwrappercheckrc)
config.description: Shell variables and comments. Used on next shim invocation.

agents.title: AGENTS.md
agents.description: Agent instructions for Cursor/Codex. Read by agents; editable here. Changes apply immediately.
agents.notExists: AGENTS.md does not exist yet. It will be created in the project root when you save.

notFound.title: Page not found
notFound.description: The requested URL does not exist.

lint.label: ESLint
lint.summary: Finds rule and quality violations in code.
lint.info: Purpose: Prevents common mistakes and style violations before shipping. Checks: Project files with ESLint rules (`npm run lint`). Pass when: ESLint exits with 0. Fail when: ESLint reports errors (exit != 0). Configure: ESLint config and rules in the project.

prettier.label: Prettier
prettier.info: Purpose: Keeps formatting consistent and review-friendly. Checks: Prettier in check mode (`npm run format:check` or `prettier --check`). Pass when: No formatting differences are found. Fail when: Formatting differences are found. Configure: Prettier config in the project.

typecheck.label: TypeScript Check
typecheck.summary: Catches TypeScript type errors before runtime.
typecheck.info: Purpose: Prevents runtime issues caused by wrong types. Checks: `tsc --noEmit` (or `npm run typecheck`). Pass when: No type errors (exit 0). Fail when: The compiler reports errors. Configure: `tsconfig.json` and TypeScript settings.

testRun.label: Vitest
testRun.info: Purpose: Ensures the app still works after changes. Checks: `npm run build` and `npm run test:run`. Pass when: Build and tests succeed. Fail when: Build or any test fails. Configure: Build and test scripts in `package.json`.

projectRules.label: Project rules
projectRules.info: Purpose: Enforces team rules beyond lint. Checks: `scripts/checks/project-rules.sh` if present. Pass when: The script exits with 0. Fail when: The script reports violations (exit != 0). Configure: Rules inside the script. Note: If the script is missing, the check is skipped.

npmAudit.label: npm audit
npmAudit.summary: Scans npm dependencies for known vulnerabilities.
npmAudit.info: Purpose: Blocks builds with known security issues. Checks: `npm audit` at the configured severity. Pass when: No findings at or above the threshold. Fail when: At least one finding at or above the threshold. Configure: `auditLevel` or `SHIM_AUDIT_LEVEL`.
npmAudit.auditLevelTooltip: Severity threshold for failure: critical (only critical), high (critical + high), moderate (+ moderate), low (+ low). Higher level = stricter.

viteBuild.label: Vite
viteBuild.summary: Ensures the frontend can be built.
viteBuild.info: Purpose: Prevents deploys with build errors. Checks: `npm run build`. Pass when: The build finishes successfully. Fail when: The build fails. Configure: Build script in `package.json`.

snyk.label: Snyk
snyk.info: Purpose: Finds additional dependency vulnerabilities. Checks: `snyk test` if Snyk is installed. Pass when: No findings, or Snyk is not installed (skipped). Fail when: Snyk reports issues. Configure: `.snyk` policy; skip with `SKIP_SNYK=1`.

denoFmt.label: Deno fmt
denoFmt.summary: Checks formatting of Supabase Edge Functions.
denoFmt.info: Purpose: Keeps Deno code formatting consistent. Checks: `deno fmt --check supabase/functions`. Pass when: No formatting differences. Fail when: Differences are found. Note: Skipped if `supabase/functions` is missing.

denoLint.label: Deno lint
denoLint.summary: Lints Deno code for Edge Functions.
denoLint.info: Purpose: Finds errors and bad practices in Deno code. Checks: `deno lint supabase/functions`. Pass when: No lint messages. Fail when: Lint messages are reported. Note: Skipped if `supabase/functions` is missing.

denoAudit.label: Deno audit
denoAudit.info: Purpose: Detects known vulnerabilities in Deno deps. Checks: `deno audit` in `supabase/functions/server`. Pass when: No findings. Fail when: Findings are reported. Note: Skipped if `supabase/functions` is missing.

aiReview.label: AI Review
aiReview.summary: AI review with fixed checklist (SOLID, DRY, security, robustness, maintainability).
aiReview.info: Purpose: Second opinion on architecture, security, and maintainability. Checks: Codex reviews snippets (changed code), full codebase, or the mix loop and returns a score and verdict. Pass when: Verdict `ACCEPT` and score >= minimum (default 95). Fail when: Verdict `REJECT` or score below minimum. Configure: `CHECK_MODE`, minimum score, timeout, and optional `SHIM_REFACTOR_MODE` (per-item handoff during refactor runs). Note: Reports are saved in `.shimwrapper/reviews/`; Codex CLI required.
aiReview.timeoutSecTooltip: Maximum runtime for the AI review in seconds. On timeout the check fails. Consider increasing for large diffs or full codebase mode.
aiReview.checkModeTooltip: mix: Refactor loop mode (manual run-checks = full chunked scan, pre-push = snippet). snippet: Only changed code snippets are reviewed (staged, unstaged, or commits being pushed). Faster, focused on your changes. full (chunked): Codebase is reviewed per directory (src, supabase, scripts, dashboard)—one diff per dir up to 150 KB, one Codex run per chunk (timeout 600 s). PASS only if all chunks get ACCEPT and score ≥ 95. Review files are named review-snippet-... or review-full-... .
aiReview.checkModeOptionMix: mix — refactor loop (manual full scan, push snippet review)
aiReview.checkModeOptionSnippet: snippet — only changed code (staged/unstaged or pushed commits)
aiReview.refactorModeTooltip: Controls optional per-item refactor workflow artifacts for --refactor runs: off = disabled, interactive = current item + resume hints, agent = handoff JSON artifacts per item.
aiReview.diffLimitBytesTooltip: Maximum size of the diff sent to the AI in bytes. Larger diffs are truncated. Relevant in full mode. Default 51200 (~50 KB).
aiReview.minRatingTooltip: Score (0–100) required for the AI review to pass. Below this value the check fails. Default 95.
aiReview.reviewDirTooltip: Directory where review reports (e.g. .md files) are saved. Path relative to project root.

explanationCheck.label: Full Explanation
explanationCheck.info: Purpose: Improves readability and maintainability. Checks: Codex verifies docstrings and inline comments for non-trivial logic. Pass when: Verdict `ACCEPT` and score >= 95. Fail when: Verdict `REJECT` or score below 95. Configure: `.shimwrappercheckrc` (SHIM_RUN_EXPLANATION_CHECK) or `--no-explanation-check`. Note: Reports in `.shimwrapper/reviews/explanation-check-*.md`.

i18nCheck.label: i18n / Translations
i18nCheck.info: Purpose: Prevents missing UI text. Checks: Code translation keys against all `messages/*.json`. Pass when: Every used key exists in every locale. Fail when: Any key is missing. Configure: `--fix` adds placeholders; skip with `--no-i18n-check`. Note: Requires `scripts/i18n-check.js`.

checkMockData.label: Check Mock Data
checkMockData.summary: Validates project mock and test data.
checkMockData.info: Purpose: Prevents invalid mock data from breaking tests. Checks: `npm run check:mock-data`. Pass when: The script exits with 0. Fail when: The script fails or is missing. Configure: Define the script in `package.json`.

updateReadme.label: Update README
updateReadme.info: Purpose: Keeps README data (e.g. version) in sync. Checks: `scripts/update-readme.js` (project) or shimwrappercheck's script. Pass when: The script runs successfully, or no script exists (skipped). Fail when: A script exists and fails. Configure: Provide or adjust the script in the project.

sast.label: Semgrep
sast.info: Purpose: Finds security patterns in code. Checks: `semgrep scan --config auto --error`. Pass when: No findings. Fail when: Findings are reported. Configure: Semgrep rules/config. Note: Skipped if Semgrep is not installed.

gitleaks.label: Gitleaks
gitleaks.info: Purpose: Prevents API keys or passwords from being committed. Checks: `gitleaks detect` against the working tree (uses `.gitleaks.toml` if present). Pass when: No matches. Fail when: Matches are found. Configure: `.gitleaks.toml`. Note: Skipped if Gitleaks is not installed.

licenseChecker.label: license-checker
licenseChecker.summary: Creates a license overview for npm dependencies.
licenseChecker.info: Purpose: Shows which licenses your dependencies use. Checks: `npx license-checker --summary` (reads `.licensecheckerrc`). Pass when: The command runs (the default runner does not fail the check). Fail when: In a strict runner, disallowed licenses are found or the command errors. Configure: `.licensecheckerrc` or CLI options. Note: The default `run-checks.sh` does not enforce failure.

architecture.label: dependency-cruiser
architecture.summary: Checks architecture rules and forbidden dependencies.
architecture.info: Purpose: Enforces module boundaries and prevents cycles. Checks: dependency-cruiser against `.dependency-cruiser.json`. Pass when: No rule violations. Fail when: Cycles or forbidden dependencies are found. Configure: `.dependency-cruiser.json`. Note: Skipped if the config is missing.

complexity.label: Complexity
complexity.info: Purpose: Keeps functions small and understandable. Checks: ESLint with `eslint-plugin-complexity` and config. Pass when: No function exceeds the threshold. Fail when: A function exceeds the threshold. Configure: `eslint.complexity.json`. Note: Skipped if no config is found.

mutation.label: Stryker
mutation.summary: Measures test quality with mutation testing.
mutation.info: Purpose: Verifies tests catch real faults. Checks: `npx stryker run` with `stryker.config.json`. Pass when: Mutation score is above the threshold. Fail when: Score is below threshold or the run fails. Configure: `stryker.config.json`. Note: Skipped if the config is missing.

e2e.label: E2E
e2e.summary: Option for end-to-end tests (must be set up in the project).
e2e.info: Purpose: Tests complete user flows. Checks: Not run by the default runner; enabling only stores the preference. Pass when: Depends on your E2E script. Fail when: Depends on your E2E script. Configure: Add an E2E command to your own `run-checks.sh`.

ruff.label: Ruff (Python)
ruff.summary: Lint and format for Python code.
ruff.info: Purpose: Prevents errors and keeps Python code consistently formatted. Checks: `ruff check .` and `ruff format --check .`. Pass when: Both commands exit with 0. Fail when: Ruff reports lint or format issues. Configure: `pyproject.toml` or `ruff.toml`. Note: Skipped if no Python files, pyproject.toml or requirements.txt are found, or Ruff is not installed (e.g. pip install ruff, brew install ruff).

shellcheck.label: Shellcheck (Shell)
shellcheck.summary: Finds common issues in shell scripts.
shellcheck.info: Purpose: Catches errors and unsafe patterns in Bash/shell scripts. Checks: All `.sh` files (excluding node_modules, .git) with shellcheck. Pass when: No messages (exit 0). Fail when: shellcheck reports errors or warnings. Configure: `.shellcheckrc` or directives in the script. Note: Skipped if no .sh files are found or shellcheck is not installed (e.g. brew install shellcheck).

healthPing.label: Post-Deploy: Health Ping
healthPing.info: Purpose: Verifies functions respond after deploy. Checks: Configured health URLs of Edge Functions. Pass when: All endpoints respond successfully (e.g. HTTP 200). Fail when: Timeouts or error codes occur. Configure: Project ref, function names, and paths.
healthPing.defaultFunctionTooltip: Name of the Edge Function called by default via GET. Must expose a health endpoint.
healthPing.healthFunctionsTooltip: Other function names to ping after deploy. Comma-separated.
healthPing.healthPathsTooltip: Path per function; {fn} is replaced by the function name. Empty = default path.
healthPing.projectRefTooltip: Supabase Project Reference (e.g. from dashboard). Required for health URL.

edgeLogs.label: Post-Deploy: Edge Logs
edgeLogs.summary: After deploy: shows the latest edge logs.
edgeLogs.info: Purpose: Quick manual verification after deploy. Checks: Fetches the latest log lines for the configured functions. Pass when: Not applicable (logs only). Fail when: Not applicable. Configure: Function names and log limit.
edgeLogs.defaultFunctionTooltip: Function whose logs are fetched by default.
edgeLogs.logFunctionsTooltip: Which functions to fetch logs for. Comma-separated; empty = default only.
edgeLogs.logLimitTooltip: Maximum log lines per fetch. Higher = more context, longer output.
